section.para: Undertaking is an independent, documentary undertaking by which the bank issues, at the request of its customer (the instructing party / applicant) its irrevocable guarantee to pay a sum of money to a third party, (the beneficiary), provided a complying demand is made.

It is usually a “passive instrument” in the sense that, once issued, it is not expected to be drawn on, because the applicant/instructing party and beneficiary will generally settle the underlying contract/relationship outside of the undertaking. The undertaking remains until its expiry and serves as security under the commercial transaction. In most cases, demands are only made when the applicant/instructing party is in breach of its underlying contract/relationship.
A payment is made to the beneficiary against a demand and presentation of specified documentation and in accordance with the terms of the undertaking.
The Undertaking forms reflects the transaction request from the perspective of an applicant and the applicant's bank, typically known as the issuing bank.

important.para: There are a few conditions that must be met for the licenses to be displayed in the popup. The following provides information for the conditions that could point to reasons that make licenses available or not available in the popup:

listitem.para: You should have created license(s) and linked it to the beneficiary selected in the Beneficiary Details section on this page. If you have selected a drawee for whom there are no licenses created, the popup will display a blank list. (This condition applies only if your administrator has selected Non-Principal Only in the License Definition. For any other selection, all licenses are available.)

Your selection of the expiry date for the Undertaking from the general details section should be within the valid to and from date of the license. Only licenses that match this criterion are displayed. If the expiry date is beyond the license validity date, the list displays blank.

Your selection of multi-currency during license creation will allow you to select a currency in the Undertaking Amount field that is different from the license currency and display the license in the popup. However, if multi-currency has not been selected, then the currency in the Undertaking Amount field has to be the same as the license field for the license to be available in the popup.

section.para: Once you have selected a license, you have to enter a value in the Allocated Amount field that is equal to the transaction amount of the Undertaking (refer to Amount Details section). If the amount available for the license is less than the transaction amount of the Undertaking, you have to add and link one or more licenses to fill for the deficit.

If you have already linked a license, the details are displayed for System ID, Back Office Reference, License Number and Allocated Amount. You can choose to delete a linked license by clicking the Delete

The provisional UI status remains 'Wording Under Review' till the Bank User changes it to 'Final Wording'. You can open and review the transaction with the status 'Final Wording' and either Accept or Reject it. Accepting it will give the choice to the Bank User to register the transaction, and rejecting it will provide the option for another cycle of negotiations based on your inputs. Once accepted by you, the Provisional UI moves from the Existing Records to the Pending Records > List of Records of the Bank User. section.title: Message to Bank - Claims
section.para: This option allows you to communicate with the bank for requesting a settlement for the UI and to process the claim.

When selected, this option presents a list of Message to Bank records that requires customers to present a request for settlement of the UI. The records displayed here follows a process where you have to initiate (to initiate a UI, refer to the topic UI Initiation) and submit a UI to the Bank, and the Bank approves your UI in the back-office from Pending Records. The record then moves to the Existing Records section in the back-office. The Bank now sets the reporting status to Claim Presentation and the UI is updated in the system, at your end, in the Message to Bank - Claims section. You are expected to enter the claim details for the UI on this screen and submit it to the Bank for further processing.

Click on the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System ID, Entity, Bank Ref., Claim Reference, Beneficiary Name or Claim Currency fields. The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

note.para: For an UI that you have marked as provisional, the Bank may move it to either of the two statuses: 'Wording Under Review' or 'Final Wording'. Open the provisional UI and either 'Accept' or 'Reject' with your reasons and supporting file uploads. This negotiation of the terms of the UI by marking it provisional is the Client Wording feature. The provisional UI status remains 'Wording Under Review' till the Bank User changes it to 'Final Wording'. You can open and review the transaction with the status 'Final Wording' and either Accept or Reject it. Accepting it will give the choice to the Bank User to register the transaction, and rejecting it will provide the option for another cycle of negotiations based on your inputs. Once accepted by you, the Provisional UI moves from the Existing Records to the Pending Records > List of Records of the Bank User. From here, the Bank User can select the appropriate option for the UI from: Wording Under Review, Final Wording, Approved and Not Processed. You can find any Approved or Not Processed UI through the UI Inquiry menu with a detailed history of the transaction.

section.title: Message to Bank - Edit
section.para: This option allows a Message to Bank that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

section.title: Message to Bank - Unsigned
section.para: This option allows a Message to Bank record that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: Maintenance - Options
section.para: The Maintenance function allows access to the UI Maintenance options through links in the left side navigation menu.
The following options are available for UI Maintenance:

listitem.para: Set and associate an entity to UI transactions.
Associate a reference to UI transactions.
List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) UI transactions.
List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.
List and optionally delete UI transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team.

section.title: Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all transactions and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now associate an entity for the Undertaking by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a transaction that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: Maintenance - Approve
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Maintenance - Purged UIs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: Maintenance - Rejected UIs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

List and optionally delete transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
